data.text: Keep silence before me, O islands;
Who raised up the righteous man from the east,
He pursued them, and passed safely;
Who hath wrought and done it,
The isles saw it, and feared;
They helped every one his neighbour;
So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith,
But thou, Israel, art my servant,
Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth,
Fear thou not; for I am with thee:
Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded:
Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that contended with thee:
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand,
Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel;
Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth:
Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away,
When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none,
I will open rivers in high places,
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree;
That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together,
Produce your cause, saith the Lord;
Let them bring them forth, and shew us what shall happen:
Shew the things that are to come hereafter,
Behold, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought:
I have raised up one from the north, and he shall come:
Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know?
The first shall say to Zion, Behold, behold them:
For I beheld, and there was no man;
Behold, they are all vanity; their works are nothing:
